author: Special Correspondent
text:
Leading publishers to take part in the fair

For the first time in Tiruchi, the Booksellers and Publishers Association of South India (BAPASI) will organise a 10-day Book Fair in the city from Friday.

Although the BAPASI has been organising book fairs in Chennai, Coimbatore, and Madurai, Tiruchi has not been on its radar so far. The BAPASI has got up the exhibition in the city following a request from the State government to host book fairs in district headquarters.

The government was extending the corporation ground, the venue at Anna Nagar in Thennur, at heavily subsidised rent, the organisers said.

“We are now making a beginning in the city and have planned to make the event an annual affair in the city as per the request of the District Collector K.S. Palanisamy. We will gradually scale up the event in the city. Tiruchi being an educational hub with a high literacy rate, we hope that the people of the city will support the initiative in a big way,” said Gandhi Kannadhasan, president, and K.S. Pugalendi, general secretary, BAPASI, addressing a press conference on the eve of the inaugural of the book fair in the city on Thursday.

The book fair will feature about 125 stalls and about one lakh titles. There will be fair mix of English and Tamil titles besides five stalls on educational multimedia.

Leading publishers, including National Book Trust and distributors, would participate in the fair. Discounts would be on offer.

Asked about the timing of the event coinciding with the public examinations this year, the organisers said the exhibition in Tiruchi would be held soon after the Chennai book fair from next year.

The book fair would be open from 11 a.m. to 9 p.m. till March 13.
title: BAPASI book expo begins today
